intro: Trichosanthes wallichiana subsp. wallichiana, commonly known as the Indian bitter melon, is a climbing vine native to the Himalayan regions of India and Nepal. It belongs to the Cucurbitaceae family, which includes cucumbers, squash, and gourds. The plant produces large, green, ribbed fruits that turn orange when mature, often used in traditional medicine and cuisine. Its leaves are heart-shaped with a rough texture, and it has tendrils that help it climb. The flowers are yellow with five petals and are typically unisexual, with separate male and female flowers on the same plant.
